intro: Jobinia tiarata, commonly known as the golden star tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble stars. The plant has compound leaves with lance-shaped leaflets and produces small, clustered fruits. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
